alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 14 at 7:44PM EDT until October 15 at 12:33AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3.0 inches of rain have fallen. 2.42 inches of rain has been observed at Greenville since 2 PM Friday afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to an inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Greenville, Guilford, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Sangerville, Parkman, Abbot, Sebec, Atkinson, Wellington, Shirley, Willimantic, Beaver Cove, Bowerbank, Onawa, Barnard and Katahdin Iron Works. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams and creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
